object.name: InlineQueryResultVenue
object.description:
Represents a venue. By default, the venue will be sent by the user. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the venue.
Note: This will only work in Telegram versions released after 9 April, 2016. Older clients will ignore them.
object.html_description:
Represents a venue. By default, the venue will be sent by the user. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the venue.

Note: This will only work in Telegram versions released after 9 April, 2016. Older clients will ignore them.
object.rst_description:
Represents a venue. By default, the venue will be sent by the user. Alternatively, you can use *input_message_content* to send a message with the specified content instead of the venue.
**Note:** This will only work in Telegram versions released after 9 April, 2016. Older clients will ignore them.

annotations.description: Type of the result, must be venue
annotations.rst_description: Type of the result, must be *venue*
annotations.name: type

annotations.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 Bytes
annotations.rst_description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 Bytes
annotations.name: id

annotations.description: Latitude of the venue location in degrees
annotations.html_description: Latitude of the venue location in degrees
annotations.rst_description: Latitude of the venue location in degrees
annotations.name: latitude

annotations.description: Longitude of the venue location in degrees
annotations.html_description: Longitude of the venue location in degrees
annotations.rst_description: Longitude of the venue location in degrees
annotations.name: longitude

annotations.description: Foursquare identifier of the venue if known
annotations.html_description: Optional. Foursquare identifier of the venue if known
annotations.rst_description: *Optional*. Foursquare identifier of the venue if known
annotations.name: foursquare_id

annotations.description: Foursquare type of the venue, if known. (For example, 'arts_entertainment/default', 'arts_entertainment/aquarium' or 'food/icecream'.)
annotations.html_description: Optional. Foursquare type of the venue, if known. (For example, “arts_entertainment/default”, “arts_entertainment/aquarium” or “food/icecream”.)
annotations.rst_description: *Optional*. Foursquare type of the venue, if known. (For example, 'arts_entertainment/default', 'arts_entertainment/aquarium' or 'food/icecream'.)
annotations.name: foursquare_type

annotations.description: Google Places identifier of the venue
annotations.html_description: Optional. Google Places identifier of the venue
annotations.rst_description: *Optional*. Google Places identifier of the venue
annotations.name: google_place_id

annotations.description: Google Places type of the venue. (See supported types.)
annotations.html_description: Optional. Google Places type of the venue. (See supported types.)
annotations.rst_description: *Optional*. Google Places type of the venue. (See `supported types <https://developers.google.com/places/web-service/supported_types>`_.)
annotations.name: google_place_type

annotations.description: Inline keyboard attached to the message
annotations.name: reply_markup

annotations.description: Content of the message to be sent instead of the venue
annotations.html_description: Optional. Content of the message to be sent instead of the venue
annotations.rst_description: *Optional*. Content of the message to be sent instead of the venue
annotations.name: input_message_content

annotations.description: Url of the thumbnail for the result
annotations.html_description: Optional. Url of the thumbnail for the result
annotations.rst_description: *Optional*. Url of the thumbnail for the result
annotations.name: thumbnail_url
